metadata.feature_description: Post wiki activities to user and group activity journals

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Wiki journal entries visible in Activity Feed

steps.action: Navigated to Community page Activity Feed
steps.expected: Wiki journal entries should appear in the activity stream
steps.actual: Multiple wiki journal entries visible showing 'authored wiki article' format with article titles, summaries, timestamps, and action links (Like, Read More, Comment, Remove)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Filter Activity Feed by Wiki entries

steps.action: Selected 'Added to Wiki' from the activity filter dropdown
steps.expected: Only wiki-related journal entries should be displayed
steps.actual: Activity feed successfully filtered to show only wiki journal entries. Multiple entries displayed including 'User Mentions Feature Test', 'Markdown Test Article - Claude Testing', 'TOC Test Article - Claude Testing', etc.

steps.action: Observed group wiki entries in Activity Feed
steps.expected: Group wiki entries should appear with group badge indicator
steps.actual: Group wiki entries (e.g., 'Test Draft Article - Created by Claude', 'Published Article Test - Claude') displayed with 'Test Activity Group' badge visible, confirming group journal integration works

steps.action: Examined journal entry structure in Activity Feed
steps.expected: Journal entries should contain author name, 'authored wiki article' text, clickable article title, content summary, timestamp, and action links
steps.actual: Journal entries correctly formatted with: Author name (Anonymous/User), 'authored wiki article' text, clickable article title link, article content summary, relative timestamp ('moments ago', '1 minute ago', etc.), and action links (Like, Read More, Comment, Remove)

observations: Code review of Journal.cs confirmed AddWikiToJournal() method creates journal entries with article title, URL, and summary
Code review of Journal.cs confirmed RemoveWikiFromJournal() method removes journal entries when articles are deleted
Code review showed group wiki entries (GroupId > 0) are assigned to SocialGroupId for proper group feed visibility
Journal entries include JournalTypeId for wiki-specific filtering ('Added to Wiki' filter option)
Article creation dialog had a Redactor editor validation issue, but existing journal entries confirmed feature functionality
